DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether rapamycin is safe and effective in the treatment of renal angiomyolipomas in patients with tuberousclerosis.
DOC.brief_title: Rapamycin In Angiomyolipomas In Patients With Tuberous Sclerosis
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of tuberousclerosis Angiomyolipoma >2cm age>10 years Creatinine >4 No recent AML bleeding No hepatic abnormalities (liver tests 2fold) Hematocrit<27% Thrombocytopenia (<100.000/mm3) Leukopenia (<3000/mm3) Ischemic cardiopathy Recent surgery (2 months prior to enrollment) Pregnancy Serum cholesterol over 7.8 mmol/l or hypertriglyceridemia fasten(>4.6 mmol/l) non controlled with drugs malignancy in the previous 2 years allergy to macrolides
